definition: to bear/to enjoy (usually in negative combination, meaning unable to enjoy)
to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: And the planet can’t afford that kind of cynicism.
sentences.chinese: 这个星球可消受不起这种玩世不恭的做法。

sentences.english: The last born has as good a right to the pleasures of youth, as the first.
sentences.chinese: 最小的和最大的同样有消受青春的权利。

sentences.english: I bestow it right and left.
Having no appetite, I did not enjoy it.
sentences.chinese: 我没有胃口，因而无福消受。

sentences.english: Life in the content of no, cannot enjoy mountain water in the cup.
sentences.chinese: 平生于物之无取，消受山中水一杯。

sentences.english: Her daughters received nothing but caresses.
sentences.chinese: 她自己的两个女儿却只消受她的爱抚。

definition: please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to do something to sb/to deal with/to cope/how?/to no avail
variant of 折殺|折杀[zhe2 sha1]
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
I appreciate your kindness (conventional reply to turn down an offer)
